glsa.title: Pound format string vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: There is a format string flaw in Pound, allowing remote execution of arbitrary code with the rights of the Pound process.

background.p: Pound is a reverse proxy, load balancer and HTTPS front-end. It allows to distribute the load on several web servers and offers a SSL wrapper for web servers that do not support SSL directly.

description.p: A format string flaw in the processing of syslog messages was discovered and corrected in Pound.

impact.p: This flaw may allow remote execution of arbitrary code with the rights of the Pound daemon process. By default, Gentoo uses the "nobody" user to run the Pound daemon.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time. All users are advised to upgrade to the latest available version of Pound.
